thread.title: Back home, Blue Jays break out to beat Royals 11-8 in Game 3
thread.title_full: Back home, Blue Jays break out to beat Royals 11-8 in Game 3

title: Back home, Blue Jays break out to beat Royals 11-8 in Game 3
text:
Updated: 11:29 p.m. Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 | Posted: 11:29 p.m. Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 Back home, Blue Jays break out to beat Royals 11-8 in Game 3 Related View Larger Toronto Blue Jays' Ryan Goins rounds the bases after hitting a solo home run against the Kansas City Royals during the fifth inning in Game 3 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Toronto. (AP Photo/Matt Slocum) View Larger Toronto Blue Jays starting pitcher Marcus Stroman reacts after a pitch against the Kansas City Royals during the sixth inning in Game 3 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Toronto. (Frank Gunn/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT View Larger Toronto Blue Jays' Russell Martin, right, reacts as he's hit by a pitch in front of Kansas City Royals catcher Salvador Perez during the second inning in Game 3 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Toronto. (Frank Gunn/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT View Larger Toronto Blue Jays' Kevin Pillar, left, dives for home plate as he scores in front of Kansas City Royals catcher Salvador Perez, back right, and starting pitcher Johnny Cueto (47) during the second inning in Game 3 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Toronto. (Frank Gunn/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT View Larger Kansas City Royals first baseman Eric Hosmer gets hit in the face with a foul ball during the fifth inning in Game 3 of baseball's American League Championship Series against the Toronto Blue Jays on Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Toronto. (AP Photo/Charlie Riedel) View Larger Kansas City Royals starting pitcher Johnny Cueto reacts after Toronto Blue Jays' Troy Tulowitzki hit a three-run homer during the third inning in Game 3 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Toronto. (Chris Young/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT By HOWIE RUMBERG The Associated Press TORONTO â€” 
Troy Tulowitzki and Josh Donaldson each homered in a six-run third inning, and Toronto's bats broke out at home for an 11-8 victory over the Kansas City Royals on Monday night that trimmed the Blue Jays' deficit to 2-1 in the AL Championship Series. 
Ryan Goins also connected and had a two-run single, one game after his misplayed pop fly set off Kansas City's winning rally Sunday. 
Veteran knuckleballer R.A. Dickey will try to get the Blue Jays even in the best-of-seven series Tuesday afternoon. He faces Kansas City's 6-foot-10 right-hander Chris Young in Game 4. 
After the resilient Royals rallied for four runs in the ninth, Roberto Osuna closed it out. 
In the first ALCS game in Toronto since 1993, Tulowitzki connected for a three-run shot off Johnny Cueto, and Donaldson hit a two-run drive off Kris Medlen as the Blue Jays hit their first home runs of the series. 
Cueto failed to retire a batter in the third inning, allowing eight runs and six hits in the worst postseason start of his career. Copyright The Associated Press
